title: Apartment Maintenance Technician
description:
**About us**

**Global Shared Living Group Inc. is New York-based company, that provides full-service Coliving services to anyone looking to move to a new city and meet new people. Coliving is a shared housing model. Our Residents share kitchens, living rooms, and other common spaces with all members, and have a private or shared bedroom of their choice. Everything is included in the flat fee: utilities, wifi, furniture, appliances, kitchen supplies, and anything else needed upon moving into a new place.** 

We are looking for ambitious, self-motivated business-oriented people, who will become the next generation of employees, who are turning the real estate market in the USA and around the world into a customer-focused industry. The role is extremely varied, and you have to have good technician skills to be able to resolve different small tasks, such as plumbing, electrical, furniture assembling, HVAC, WiFi, locks, etc. You must be comfortable interacting with our residents regularly with respect and deliver excellent service. The role includes communication with other management companies and technical services to get issues resolved other than our ability.

*Responsibilities:* 

* Manage and oversee all maintenance aspects of a portfolio of properties
* Delivery of supplies from the warehouse to our locations around the City.
* Complete all resident and site work orders of apartment maintenance as directed
* Schedule and oversee third-party trade partners, ensuring the safety, quality, and cleanliness of work performed
* Maintenance duties of our properties may include but are not limited to:
* Light plumbing work (clogged toilet or bathtub, small leak, etc.)
* Furniture assembling (plus minor repairs)
* Painting (touch-up)
* Interior maintenance
* Light electrical work
* Appliance evaluation and repair
* Other aesthetic work as needed
* Help suggest improvements
* Conduct regular inspections of houses to ensure proper operation

*Requirements:* 

* 2+ year of maintenance experience
* The vehicle is required to be used on an occasional basis, usually once a week (gas will be compensated)
* ​​Flexibility with work schedule - this is not a typical 9-5 job. There will be times when on-call status may be required. You must be available to provide and maintain a flexible schedule.
* Ability to work with some basic tools, as well as specialist power tools. Having your tools is desirable
* Ability to represent yourself professionally with Residents and team members
* Ability to work independently and utilize technology to communicate with the team

Terms of employment:

* 2-month fully paid probationary period;
* Work hours - 40 hours per week, according to the weekly schedule;
* The candidate should be able to work out of the regular business hours if there is an emergency;
* A total of 2 paid vacation weeks is provided per year. 1 week for every 6 months of work.

**Compensation is $50,000 per year + overtime or additional tasks above the regular responsibilities.** 

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Paid time off

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Do you have a vehicle to be used for work at least once a week? If yes, please indicate the model.

Experience:

* Maintenance: 2 years (Required)

Work Location: Multiple locations

title: Leasing Agent
description:
**WHAT'S THIS ALL ABOUT?**

Are you a leasing team member looking to be a part of an organized, patient, and creative team? **Are you a leasing team member who has LOTS of experience with organizing 55+ focused resident events?** Work with community at Cedar Street Commons Apartments! Take a look at what you would be doing on a daily basis and then press, "Apply"!

But 1st- let us tell you about the Goldberg Realty organization and experience. Goldberg Realty Associates is a long lasting, family owned and managed multi-family and multi-generational organization. Since 1964, the Goldberg Realty Associates team has been committed to their residents, communities, and fellow team members!

**Here is a glimpse of what you will be accomplishing, doing, and provide:**

**This role is for a** ***LEASING AGENT AND ACTIVITIES COORDINATOR*** **at our gorgeous Cedar Street Apartment location in beautiful Livingston, NJ. Total number of apartments is with the opportunity to work with 55+ residents!**

**Marketing/Sales/Leasing/Customer Service**

* Handle sales, outreach, prospecting and lead generation with a focus on converting leads into sales.
* Manage all email leads, focusing on creating appointments and follow up. Entering all leads into the Yardi database.
* Greet prospective residents and show apartments as needed.

**Social Activities:**

* Compose and distribute monthly newsletter – maintain a calendar of daily activities and effectively communicate and publicize events to residents and prospective residents. Coordinate setup and breakdown of events with on-site staff.
* Plan monthly activities – correspond with and be on-site liaison to outside vendors regarding daily events. Schedule all events monthly. Work with staff and vendors to ensure daily events run smoothly. Continue already established events/clubs while looking for new things to add to schedule.
* Participate and oversee all activities including clubs, resident events, trips – be present and active in all activities, on property and off. Arrange travel to and from all off-site activities. Receive all funds for monthly bus trip, proper notes and attendance taking required.
* Submit monthly invoices for activities – receive all vendor invoices for events/clubs, ensure they are received by Accounts Payable team in timely manner. Submitting budgeting recommendations for event equipment and supplies.

**Administrative / Operations**

* Process applications and lease renewals.
* Enter guest cards and traffic information.
* Assist new residents during the move-in process.
* Work with the maintenance department to handle apartment turnovers, move-ins and move-outs, and work order requests.
* Handle administrative functions to include clerical and reception responsibilities.
* Maintain effective internal controls over operational activities in compliance with best practice policies and guidelines.
* Handles the renewal process to include generating renewals, following up on unsigned renewals, handling NTV’s and creating month to month charges and rent increases for unreturned expired leases
* Assisting with accounts receivables
* Assists with obtaining online reviews and boosting property online reputation

**Qualifications:**

* Previous experience in leasing, sales and customer service.
* Ability to develop rapport with a wide range of people.
* Ability to complete multiple tasks while keeping a positive attitude.
* Attention to detail.
* Written and verbal communication skills.
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office products.
* Proficiency with Yardi Voyager.

**BENEFITS FOR YOU:**

* **Medical, Dental, and Vision healthcare options.**
* **15 Days PTO and 2 Floating Holidays**
* **8 Federal Holidays**
* **16 Hours of PAID Volunteering Hours**
* **Monthly Employee Of The Month Reward (i.e. $500.00 and a PAID day off!)**
* **Employee Birthdays Off**
* **Employee Work Anniversary Awards**
* **Pet Bereavement**
* **Employee Referral Awards**
* **Monthly Employee Engagement**
* **Learning Opportunities with and outside of the organization (i.e. New Jersey Apartment Association)**
* **And more!**

*Goldberg Realty is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or any other legally protected status, in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. We provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type in our workplace.*

description:

title: FT - Administrative Assistant/Receptionist
description:
Title: Real Estate Administrator

Job Description:

Are you a detail-oriented professional with a passion for real estate? Do you thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy managing multiple tasks simultaneously? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as a Real Estate Administrator.

As a Real Estate Administrator, you will play a key role in supporting our real estate team by handling administrative tasks and ensuring the smooth operation of our real estate transactions. Your responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

* Assisting with the preparation and processing of real estate documents, such as listing agreements.
* Coordinating property showings, inspections, and appraisals.
* Managing communication between clients, agents, lenders, and other stakeholders.
* Maintaining and organizing electronic and physical real estate files.
* Handling inquiries from clients and providing excellent customer service.
* Assisting with marketing activities, including creating listing flyers and social media content.
* Performing general office duties, such as answering phones, scheduling appointments, and managing emails.

Qualifications:

* Previous experience in real estate administration or a related field is preferred.
* Strong organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite and other relevant software.
* Ability to prioritize tasks and work efficiently in a fast-paced environment.
* Knowledge of real estate laws and regulations is a plus.
* High school diploma or equivalent; additional education or certification in real estate is a bonus.

If you are a motivated individual with a passion for real estate and a desire to excel in a dynamic team environment, we encourage you to apply for this position. Join us and take the next step in your real estate career!

To apply, please submit your resume and cover letter detailing your relevant experience and why you are the ideal candidate for this role. We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Fare Evasion /Data Analyst
description:
**Job Summary**  
**Critical Key requirements**

* Proficient written and oral communication skills in English as well as the ability to collect and interpret data effectively from various verbal and written sources
* Proficiency in Microsoft Windows based operating systems, Microsoft Office, and other applications
* Proven ability to act in a professional manner and maintain a positive attitude.

\\* Ability to work in a multi-faceted, fast- paced and high intensity emergency environment while maintaining a calm and professional demeanor.

\\* Previous experience gathering, organizing and managing computer data.

\\* Work experience with regional, municipal and / or police agencies

**SUMMARY OF THE FUNCTION/ROLE** 

The New York State Metropolitan Transportation Authority (“MTA”) is a municipal organization responsible for efficient public transportation in the New York metropolitan area.

The goal of MTA Headquarters, Department of Safety & Security (“MTA HQ S&S”) is to maintain a safe and secure transportation environment for both customers and employees and aims to enhance safety through the services of two (2) Fare Evasion / Data Analysts to gather and review fare evasion data per the instruction of the cognizant Director Data Information and Analysis or designee. This position is to provide critical support for MTA HQS&S”) needs.

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

* **DATA GATHERING** - The successful applicant shall engage in obtaining and gathering statistic data concerning incidences of fare evasion occurring at various MTA locations, as detailed herein. This service includes, but is not limited to, the dictates of workflow requirements as stated by the cognizant Director Data Information and Analysis.
* **COMPILING and REVIEWING RECORDS** - The successful fare evasion / data analyst professional shall utilize current MTA designated computer interfaces and systems, as detailed herein to include both internal reports and databases.
* **DATA ANALYSIS** - Under the direction of the cognizant Director Data Information and Analysis, the Fare Evasion / Data Analyst Consultant will be responsible for the successful analysis and presentation of data. Data analysis includes the ability to compile crime related data fields, enter data, assign priorities, follow Standard Operations Procedures (“SOP”) and determine relevancy. Data collection and gathering from various MTA Agencies for daily security operational statistics. Development of action plans, schedules, and keeping meeting participants currently appraised.
* Connect and integrate data from various sources, such as databases, spreadsheets, and cloud services, into Power BI datasets.
* Clean and organize data to ensure it is suitable for reporting and analysis.
* Develop and maintain reports and dashboards which provide data insight and support management decision-making.
* Identify areas of system optimization based on business processes.
* Follow security measures to ensure data confidentiality and compliance with data protection regulations.
* Collaborate with business analysts, data engineers, and other stakeholders to understand requirements and deliver solutions that meet business needs.
* Create and maintain documentation for data models, report specifications, and best practices.

**QUALIFICATIONS EXPERIENCE & EDUCATION**

* Bachelor’s degree in information systems, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related field.
* Must possess a valid State issued Driver’s License.
* Solid experience in working with relational databases.
* Excellent analytical skills with the ability to dissect large amounts of data.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to effectively convey complex information.
* Experience in the transportation especially in railroad industry is a plus.
* 4+ years of experience in Reporting and Dashboards.
* 4+ years in database technologies and strong writing skills.
* Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst certified preferred.
* Good communication skills to translate business requirements into Dashboards and Reporting
* Proficient in MS Office applications, Word, Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, Project
* Excellent oral, written and presentation communication skill in relating technical information to non-technical personnel.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
* Ability to effectively prioritize and execute in a high-pressure environment.
* Ability to independently set priorities and meet deadlines.
* Excellent inter-personal skills including the ability to work with individuals at all levels of the organization

title: Brooklyn Book Festival Volunteer
description:
We invite you to join us as a volunteer at this year's Brooklyn Book Festival in downtown Brooklyn, New York.

Each year volunteers at our Festival Day and Literary Marketplace, and Children’s Day help make the Festival a great literary celebration for all who attend – authors and audiences alike.

This year's Festival Dates are below:

Brooklyn Book Festival & Literary Marketplace – September 29, 2024

Children’s Day and Book Market – September 28, 2024

To see this year's lineup, check our the Author's tab on our website.

https://brooklynbookfestival.org/authors/

**Volunteer Opportunities include:**

- Helps bring authors from the Green Room to their program location and to the signing location

- helps authors keep the line moving by prepping autographs and making sure the signing location is stocked with supplies

- keeps tabs on audience attendance and assists in the program starting and ending on time

- Helps keep the lines for entry to a program and/or the signing location orderly

- Helps provides information about program locations, schedules, the Literary Marketplace, and other related requests

- can be assigned to any of the above tasks as needed.

**In order to volunteer, you must attend one of these five virtual Volunteer Training Sessions.**

Monday, September 9th at 6 PM

Tuesday, September 10th at 6 PM

Wednesday, September 11th at 9 AM

Thursday, September 12th at 6 PM

Saturday, September 14th at 10 AM

All volunteers will receive an official Brooklyn Book Festival Volunteer T-shirt to be worn during volunteer shifts. Lunch will be provided for those who work full-day shifts. Snacks and refreshments will also be available.

**Interested in volunteering with us? Please register at the link below by September 1st, 2024:**

https://airtable.com/appbmMuSpDZeLMerY/shrF51WTOip07bqKs

title: Domestic Violence Advocate
description:
**Title: Domestic Violence Advocate**

**Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Knowledge of dynamics associated with Domestic Violence and related issues as follows: incest, sexual assault, physical, financial and mental abuse.
* Maintain case load of clients with domestic violence issues as stated above
* Provide case management services for above mentioned clients
* Provide advocacy services and interact with other agencies and organizations on behalf of above mentioned clients
* Provide referral services to other agencies and organizations for above mentioned clients
* Escort clients in situations dealing with domestic violence issues such as court dates, and other domestic violence related appointments
* Translating forms and documents for clients
* Interpreting paperwork, documents, and conversations for clients
* Maintaining accurate client files
* Recording client interactions in daily activity log
* Collecting client donations and recording donations in daily activity log
* Completing/Submitting monthly statistical report as directed
* Maintaining an atmosphere of support, confidentiality and ethical standards for all clients
* Attending conferences and training as assigned in order to enhance job performance
* Adhering to the agency’s personnel policy manual
* Displaying personal qualities of integrity, credibility, commitment and passion for the agency mission
* Reaching out to the local community to inform them about CARC services available to them
* Performing other related duties as assigned
* Assistance with agency fundraising efforts

**Qualifications:**

* **Excellent oral, written bilingual skills required. Bilingual (SPANISH) required.**
* Associates’ Degree in Human Services or other related field or at least two years’ experience in Human Services.
* Bachelor's Degree Preferably
* Able to advocate with cultural sensitive competence and confidentiality.
* Must be capable of working with diverse populations
* Working knowledge of computer programs such as Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
* Weekends and Evenings may be required as needed
* Posses a Valid New Jersey driver’s license and have access to an automobile

**Physical Requirements:**

* Ability to work indoors at a desk for extended periods of time.
* Ability to work outdoors traveling to other job sites as needed and if required.
* Ability to lift and carry 10-20 lbs. as needed.
* Listen, talk, interact, and effectively communicate with other employees, supervisors, and outside clients.
* Standing and/or sitting for extended periods of time.
* Use of phone and computer for extended periods of time.
* Bending, reaching, and twisting in the performance of daily job functions.
* Seeing, reading, writing, and utilizing a computer keyboard, mouse, and other computer implements.
* Ability to work a set schedule consistent with the job and/or agency needs.

title: Teacher
description:
**Benefits:**  

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

  

We seek a passionate, dedicated, Experienced Teacher to join our team.  

  

At The Learning Experience, you can have the opportunity to create a positive and engaging learning environment for children, where "*happy happens here*" is not just a motto but a way of life.  

  

We are looking for someone committed to helping children learn, play, grow, and thrive and providing the tools they need to succeed academically and emotionally.  

If you are a caring and creative individual passionate about working with preschool children, we encourage you to apply for this exciting Teacher opportunity.  

  

**What We Offer:**  

  

* State-of-the-Art Classrooms: Our immersive classroom setting utilizes the latest technology, materials, and resources to allow children to "learn, play, and grow.”
* Opportunities for Growth: We offer ongoing training and professional development, tuition reimbursement, and leadership pathways to help you meet your goals as an educator.
* Competitive benefits and premium compensation


  

**As a Teacher, you will:**  

  

* Create a welcoming, engaging classroom space for young children to learn, play and grow
* Use a growth mindset to develop young minds and inspire a love of learning
* Implement our proprietary L.E.A.P. Curriculum®, working with Infants, Toddlers, or Preschool children in a way that is consistent with the unique needs of each child.
* Create a safe, nurturing environment where children can play and learn.
* Communicate regularly with parents, sharing their children’s latest adventures and achievements through various avenues, including mobile apps and personal discussions.
* Support your center’s success, partnering with center staff and leadership to achieve goals around enrollment and engagement.
* Build relationships with families and coworkers and create a dynamic environment where play and learning happen seamlessly.


  

**Do You:**  

* Have a genuine passion for the education and care of children?
* Have one year of professional teaching experience (preferred) or six months of professional teaching experience (required)?

Have an associate degree or higher in ECE or related degree (preferred) or High school diploma/GED (required)?  
* 

If so, **Apply Now** because we would love to meet you!  

  

 **Teacher** **Benefits**
  

* Paid time off
* Dental Insurance
* 401(k)
* Vision insurance
* Tuition reimbursement
* 401(k) matching
* Referral program
* Employee discount
* Professional development assistance

  

**TLE Cares Benefits Package – Because we care about you.**  

*Our Center proudly offers TLE Cares, a comprehensive benefits package for all team members. All premiums for TLE Cares are fully paid by our Center’s owner, with no cost to our employees.*  

  

**TLE Cares includes:**  

* Dental & Vision Insurance
* Short & Long-term Disability Insurance
* Life Insurance
* Employee Assistance Program
* Lifemart Employee Discount Program

  

There are applicable state licensing requirements for the role.

title: Registered Nurse, Emergency Department
description:
**\\*\\*\\*SIGN ON BONUS AVAILABLE UP TO $15,000\\*\\*\\***

At Saint Clare's Health, our dedicated team of professionals are committed to our core values of quality, compassion, and community. As a member of Prime Healthcare, Saint Clare's Health is actively seeking new members to join its award-winning team!

Saint Clare's Health includes CMS 5-Star Rated hospitals and is an award-winning provider of safe, high quality, compassionate care, serving the communities of Morris, Warren and Sussex counties. Its network of hospitals and healthcare facilities include Denville Hospital, Dover Hospital, Behavioral Health Centers in Boonton, Denville, and Parsippany, and an Imaging Center in Parsippany, among other satellite locations. The hospitals have received multiple quality awards including Leapfrog “A” ratings for patient safety; Healthgrades recognition for orthopedic surgery, treatment of stroke, heart care, various surgical procedures, and more. For information, visit www.saintclares.com.

*We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against applicants due to veteran status, disability, race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, or other protected characteristics. If you need special accommodation for the application process, please contact Human Resources. Know Your Rights: https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/2022-10/EEOC\\_KnowYourRights\\_screen\\_reader\\_10\\_20.pdf*

The Registered Nurse is responsible for the delivery of safe patient care utilizing the nursing process of assessment, planning, implementation and evaluation. Provides direct patient care within the scope of practice. The Registered Nurse also directs and guides patient/family teaching and activities of other nursing personnel while maintaining standards of professional nursing care in Telemetry. The Registered Nurse is directly responsible and accountable for the care given to his/her patients in the Emergency Department. He / She communicates with the physician about the changes in the patient's clinical condition including results of the diagnostic studies and symptomatology. Is capable of responding quickly and accurately to changes in the condition and/or response to treatment. Is knowledgeable about EMTALA regulations and reporting of child/adult abuse to appropriate agencies and Hospital Social Worker. Maintains patient privacy and confidentiality.

**EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, TRAINING**

1. Current and valid state RN License.  
2. Current BLS certificate upon hire and maintain current.  
3. Current ACLS certificate 30 days upon hire and maintain current.  
4. Current PALS certificate and/or ENPC 30 days upon hire and maintain current.  
5. Minimum of one year experience as a staff nurse RN in an acute care hospital setting; E.R. setting preferred.  
6. Certified Emergency Nurse (CEN) preferred.  
7. Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) preferred.

Facility Specific Requirements (facility may require items listed below):

1. In Paramedic Base Station ED: MICN within 12 months of hire and maintain current.  
2. EDAP certified facilities: Completion of emergency pediatric course 1 and 2 within 6 months of hire.  
3. Non-OB facilities: NRP certificate 90 days upon hire and maintain current.  
4. Trauma Nurse Core Course (TNNC) within 12 months of hire required.

title: 2025 Business Summer Internship Program
description:
**Company Description**  

We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable.

 **Job Description**  

Verisk‘s Summer Internship Program is designed to provide you with real work experience, professional development, and networking opportunities. This is a full-time (40 hours/ week) paid internship program spanning ten weeks from June through August 2025. Participation in the internship program requires that you are located near your assigned office as the program is a hybrid work schedule, requiring you to be in the office at least 2 days per week.


At Verisk, we have a longstanding commitment to inclusion, diversity & belonging in our workplace and marketplace. Click here to read our statement on Racial, Equity and Diversity and learn more about our Employee Network Groups and our commitment to making a change.

**A Glimpse of Roles We’re Looking to Fill:**

* Data Analyst
* Human Resources
* Marketing Research
* Product Development

**What You Could Learn:**

* Conduct immersive research, analyze data, and develop innovative future programs to benefit our customers.
* Participate in detail-oriented risk or financial initiatives for our global company and/ or our clients. Depending on your experience and placement, you could be focused on technical analysis, risk, insurance, or consulting.
* Case law review, how regulatory requirements impact our core products (ISO forms and rules), and the filing process to get such changes approved by the state insurance departments for use for our customers.
* Work with our industry data partners to ensure the accuracy of our insurance-industry-experience database.
* Build professional relationships with other interns, coworkers and customers while offering support across business units.
* New technologies, including Microsoft access, excel, sql, and more.

  

**Qualifications** **What We’re Looking For:**

**Skills and Knowledge**

* Seeking those who are collaborative, well rounded, passionate, and good work ethic.
* Strong communication skills, responsible, and highly motivated to take initiative.
* Ability to learn, problem-solve and work independently on projects.
* Have a growth mindset to complete all responsibilities and be eager to learn.


You'll notice we did not list specific skills. That's because the "stuff" that matters, the passion, the quantitative mindset, the ability to be a good teammate but also operate independently - these are what we are evaluating you on. We seek innovators who can add to our culture, contribute to our growth, and strive for excellence.

**Experience**

* Enrolled in bachelors or masters program. We love folks with varied coursework, but you must possess an analytical mindset, passion for business, and a desire to innovate. Risk Management & Insurance majors, a plus.
* A history of tackling projects with a quantitative lens, and a desire for data-driven insights.
* Verisk serves the insurance vertical so an interest or past experience in insurance is helpful, though not required.
* Technical skill requirements vary depending on the position. Be sure to include your technical skillset on your resume, and we can go from there. At a minimum, you should have Microsoft excel as a foundation.

***The Internship Program is not eligible for work visa sponsorship. If you will require work visa sponsorship (e.g., H1-B visa)” after completing your degree, you do not meet the basic requirements of the summer intern role.***

 **Recruitment Process:**


We want to get to know YOU. Once you apply, our team will review your application. Successful candidates will be invited to a two-stage interview process including:

* **Online Assessment:** Our team is eager to get to know you better. During this session, you’ll be introduced to several of our team leaders who will ask you a series of prerecorded questions to understand what motivates you and where your interests lie. This is your chance to make yourself stand out from the pack. Additionally, you will complete a short Excel test to assess your proficiency with basic Excel functionalities.
* **Final Live Virtual Interview:** This round is to determine if Verisk’s culture is right for you. You'll have the opportunity to speak with several members of our business recruitment committee.
* **Offer:** Our committee will meet and discuss your candidacy. Should you be extended an offer, we will advise you of the specific role and location where your internship will take place.

  

**Additional Information**  

In 2022, Verisk received Great Place to Work® Certification for our outstanding workplace culture for the sixth year in a row and second-time certification in the UK, Spain, and India. We’re also one of the 38 companies on the UK’s Best Workplaces™ list and one of 18 companies on Spain’s Best Workplaces™ list.


For over fifty years and through innovation, interpretation, and professional insight, Verisk has replaced uncertainty with precision to unlock opportunities that deliver significant and demonstrable impact. From our historic roots in risk assessment, we’ve grown to provide analytic insights that help transform industries focused on some of the world’s most critical areas. Today, the insurance industry relies on Verisk to be, and to make the world, more productive, resilient, and sustainable.


Verisk works in collaboration with our customers and at the intersection of people, data, and advanced technologies. Through proprietary platformed analytics, advanced modeling, and interpretation, we deliver immediate and sustained value to our customers and through them, to the individuals and societies they serve, with greater speed, precision, and scale.


We’re 9,000 people strong, committed to translating big data into big ideas. We help others see new possibilities and empower certainty into big decisions that impact individuals and societies. And we relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation to help move our customers, and the world, toward better tomorrows.  

  

Everyone at Verisk—from our chief executive officer to our newest employee—is guided by The Verisk Way, to Be Remarkable, Add Value, and Innovate.  

* Be Remarkable by doing something better each day in service to our customers and each other
* Add Value by delivering immediate and sustained results that drive positive outcomes
* Innovate by redefining what’s possible, embracing challenges, and pushing boundaries
**Verisk Businesses**


Underwriting Solutions — provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precision


Claims Solutions — supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiences


Property Estimating Solutions — offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficient


Extreme Event Solutions — provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events.


Specialty Business Solutions — provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governance


Marketing Solutions — delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing, relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagement


Verisk Maplecroft — provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become stronger


At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the 7th consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by *Forbes* as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work.


Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.


All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.


http://www.verisk.com/careers.html


Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.


HR CCPA Privacy Notice.pdf

**At Verisk, the health and safety of our people is our number one priority.** **Effective November 15, 2021, and subject to applicable law, all prospective hires for office based roles or roles that support any of our businesses’ government contracts will be required to demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, or qualify for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation to this vaccination requirement, as a condition of employment. Hired candidates who do not demonstrate that they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by their start date, and who have not been approved for a legally-required medical or religious accommodation will no longer meet the requirements for employment and their offers of employment will be immediately rescinded, in accordance with applicable law.**

title: Asphalt Sealcoating Crew member
description:
Job Overview  
We are seeking seasonal full-time/part-time individuals who are willing and able to learn asphalt sealcoating and repair skills to join our team. Be part of an independent 2-person sealcoating crew and enjoy working outdoors!

Fun, Teamwork atmosphere

* Fast upward mobility
* Experience a plus, but not required. Will train.

The ideal candidate will have experience in asphalt sealcoating residential driveways and commercial parking lots. This position offers an opportunity to work in a dynamic environment where precision and attention to detail are key.

Responsibilities  
- Apply sealcoating to mostly private residential driveways and some commercial parking lots  
- Prepare surfaces for sealcoating by blowing and edging as needed  
- Operate power tools and hand tools to assist in the sealing process  
- Assemble and disassemble equipment for maintenance and cleaning

**Requirements:** Must have a valid NJ driver's license. Clean record preferred. Must be willing to work outdoors and be able to lift 50 pounds. Must be willing to work weekends when necessary.

Send resume to rr@jet-black.com.

Season will go from April until late October.

Learn Career Skills in Entrepreneurship:

* Time Management
* Problem Solving
* Customer Service
* Leadership & more!

Salary: $200 to $250+ per day (based on full-time hours, weather dependent)

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Temporary

Pay: $20.00 - $30.00 per hour

Expected hours: 10 – 40 per week

Benefits:

* On-the-job training

Schedule:

* 10 hour shift
* 12 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Hillsborough, NJ 08844 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Staff RN-Methadone Clinic-Per Diem
description:
Join our Methadone Clinic team at Montefiore Mount Vernon, a community based hospital which is part of the Montefiore Health System, a premier academic health system serving more than 3 million people living in the New York City region and Hudson Valley. We are seeking a per diem RN to join our staff. Availability during the week, 5:45-11:30 a.m.

Job Duties include:

* Safely medicates patients on a daily basis
* Documents verbal orders and signatures
* Maintains policies and procedures/ensures methadone is safely stored.
* Will perform regulatory requirements including pain and nutritional assessments.
* Treating patients accurately and safely according to unit specific parameters and best practices.
* Provides for patient confidentiality, privacy and dignity.
* Responds appropriately in emergency situations.
* Is aware of ethical concerns and makes appropriate referrals to ethics committee.
* Identifies and immediately reports any hazardous situations to management.
* Participates in and positively influences quality improvement initiatives.

**Education and Requirements:**

* 2-3 yrs of prior experience in a substance abuse program
* New York State Nursing License.
* BLS
* Associate's degree required.
* BSN degree preferred.
* Infection control training certification in specialty preferred
* Effective English communication skills, both written and oral
* Ability to use basic data entry and retrieval systems

Apply today and be a part of a supportive work environment where growth and development is encouraged.

Pay: $80.79 per hour

Physical Setting:

* Clinic

Experience:

* RN substance Abuse: 2 years (Required)

License/Certification:

* BLS Certification (Required)
* RN (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Adult Day Care Social Worker
description:
**We are looking for a Adult Day Care Social Worker!**

**Social Worker Responsibilities:**

* Assisting clients in receiving services by telephone and in-person.
* Getting clients involved in beneficial activities.
* Assessing clients and collecting relevant information.
* Offering information and supporting clients and their families.
* Contacting and making referrals to other agencies and services.
* Maintaining accurate records and preparing reports.
* Participating in training, supervision, and meetings.

**Social Worker Requirements:**

* Has to be an LCSW (Licensed clinical social worker)
* Has to be Bilingual
* Bachelor's degree in psychology, social work, or related field.
* Ability to give full attention to what social service clients are saying, understand the points being made, ask questions, and not interrupt inappropriately.
* Awareness of others’ reactions and understanding why they react as they do.
* Ability to judge the relative costs and benefits of potential social service and health care actions and choose the most appropriate one.
* Comfortable using a computer for various tasks.
* Ability to stay calm and empathize with clients when they are upset.
* Able to develop a treatment plan.
* Knowledge of crisis intervention.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 - $25.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Language:

* Spanish (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Certified Social Worker (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Jersey City, NJ 07097: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Construction Office Manager/Bookkeeper
description:
Responsibilities to include but not limited to:

- Oversee and manage the daily operations of the office, Monday through Friday  
- Coordinate and schedule appointments and meetings between owner & clients or subcontractors  
- Assist owner in any correspondence to clients as well as with creating estimates for new jobs or new work within an existing job  
- Maintain and organize office files, records, and documents including all insurances, licenses, and registrations  
- Maintain schedule for all jobs in progress, including ordering materials, scheduling inspections, and filling out permit applications  
- Responsible for the organization of the Project Management software and making sure that all files are up to date  
- Responsible for ordering materials for jobs and checking to make sure orders that are sent, as well as their pricing, are accurate  
- Responsible for coordinating deliveries from vendors to job sites  
- Responsible for keeping financial accounting of all jobs in progress, including billing to clients and payments to sub contractors and vendors  
- Provide clerical support such as answering phone calls, responding to emails, and handling correspondence  
- Ensure office supplies are stocked and equipment is properly maintained

Qualifications:  
- MUST HAVE previous experience working in a Construction Office (It is a plus if you have Estimating or Project Management Experience within the Construction Industry)  
- Strong experience using QuickBooks, Microsoft Office Suite, Google G-Suite/Drive, and Project Management Software  
- Proven experience in office management or a related role that required close work with a C-Level Executive/Owner  
- Strong organizational skills with the ability to multitask and prioritize tasks effectively  
- Proficient in file management, including both physical and digital files  
- Familiarity budgeting processes, accounts receivable/payable  
- Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal  
- Attention to detail and accuracy in all aspects of work  
- Ability to maintain confidentiality of sensitive information (will be required to sign an NDA at start of employment)

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* Microsoft Office: 2 years (Preferred)
* Administrative experience: 3 years (Required)
* QuickBooks: 2 years (Required)
* Construction estimating: 1 year (Preferred)
* Construction Industry: 3 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Deal, NJ 07723 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Porter/Maintenance
description:
We are seeking a dedicated and reliable Porter/Janitor to maintain the cleanliness and orderliness of our millwork manufacturing facility. This role is essential in ensuring a clean, organized, and pleasant environment for our production teams and visitors. Responsibilities include routine cleaning, bathroom maintenance, and snow removal during winter months.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Sweep, mop, and vacuum floors throughout the facility, including production areas, offices, and restrooms.
* Dust and wipe down surfaces, including machinery, workstations, and office furniture.
* Clean windows, glass partitions, and mirrors as needed.
* Empty and dispose of trash and recycling in designated containers.
* Restock supplies in restrooms and kitchen areas.
* Perform detailed cleaning of restrooms, including toilets, sinks, mirrors, and floors.
* Monitor and report any maintenance or repair needs to the Facilities Manager.
* Ensure all cleaning equipment and supplies are well-maintained and stored properly.
* Assist in setting up and breaking down equipment or furniture for meetings or events.
* Remove snow and ice from walkways, parking lots, and entrance areas during winter months to ensure safe access to the facility.
* Use snow removal equipment and salt/sand as necessary to manage snow and ice conditions.
* Assist with moving materials or equipment as needed within the facility.
* Provide support to other departments during high-demand periods or special projects.
* Maintain a positive and professional attitude while interacting with team members and visitors.

**Qualifications:**

* Previous janitorial or custodial experience preferred but not required. Experience in a manufacturing or industrial environment is a plus.
* Ability to operate and maintain cleaning equipment and tools.
* Basic knowledge of cleaning chemicals and their safe usage.
* Ability to perform snow removal tasks and operate related equipment.
* Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
* Good communication skills and the ability to work independently.
* Ability to lift and carry up to [specific weight, e.g., 50 lbs] and perform physical tasks such as bending, reaching, and standing for extended periods.
* Comfortable working in a manufacturing environment with exposure to dust and noise.
* Ability to work outdoors in varying weather conditions for snow removal tasks.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.28 - $19.88 per hour

Expected hours: 40 – 42 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Overtime

Ability to Commute:

* Melville, NY (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Home Health Aide - Full Time & Part Time
description:
Home Health Aide - The Opportunity You have Been Waiting For is Right Here!


Are you searching for a career that can offer you work/life balance and a feeling of accomplishment through helping others? Are you looking for Part-Time Work? How about Full-Time Work? Interested in earning extra $$$ with a little OVERTIME? Maybe you are only looking to work Overnights or on the Weekends? Have you have been in the Home Care Industry for a while yet you still can't find an agency that offers flexibility, compassion and a staff that will WORK WITH YOU, NOT AGAINST YOU?

  

If you answered YES to ANY of these questions, then Come join The 2024 Employer of Choice and Provider of Choice Award Winner from Caring.Com and a 2024 Great Place to Work Certified Homecare Agency, **Right at Home**!

 **About Us**: Right at Home is an in home care service provider for residents of **Monmouth** and **Ocean Counties**. We provide services for seniors and disabled adults who need some assistance with daily living. By doing so, we allow our clients to enjoy the ability to stay home longer and have a better overall quality of life. We have been taking care of our neighbors since 2004 and have been growing ever since.  



  

Why HHAs love working for us- Right at Home is all about recognizing and rewarding our hard-working staff.

  

Some perks of working with RIGHT AT HOME are but not limited to:

  

* Free Career Consultation From our Professional Recruiting Staff
* Same Day Pay Available
* 401K
* Health Insurance for as little as $15 a paycheck
* Competitive Wage Matching
* $1000 Sign-On and Referral Bonus
* Paid Vacation and Holidays
* Paid Sick Time
* Free Tele-Medicine for all Full-Time employees
* Company provided PPE to keep you safe!

And most importantly, we don't only offer a job, we offer CAREER GROWTH! Ask us about our Executive Staff Aide and Mentor Positions to advance your career.




Job Duties:

  

Performs personal care activities that assist the patient with activities of daily living which include (but are not limited to):  



  

* Personal hygiene (assisting to bathroom or in using a bedpan, bathing, care of mouth, shaving, skin, and hair)
* Ambulation/Transfers
* Dressing/Shaving
* Prepares meals and snacks according to instructions or special diets.
* Accompany patient on errands or medical appointments.
* Performs housekeeping activities which include (but are not limited to): vacuuming, dusting, sweeping or mopping floors, doing dishes, changing bed linens, doing laundry and cleaning bathroom
* Performs patient-specific activities that are taught by a Right at Home nurse. These could include (but are not limited to):
* Medication reminders
* Assisting with the prescribed range of motion exercises
* Understanding dementia care
* Incontinence care

  

Qualifications and Skills:

  

* High school graduate or G.E.D. Certificate.
* Must hold a NJ Certified Home Health Aide (CHHA) License.
* Ability to read, write, speak and understand English as needed for the job.
* Possess a valid driver’s license and insured automobile preferred but not necessary.

A 1-Step PPD OR QuantiFERON with Negative results dated no older than one year. Positive results require a chest x-ray dated no older than 5 years.  
* 

  

If you consider yourself a hard-working HHA that is looking to make a difference with a company that values you, we would love to hear from you. Apply today for immediate consideration!

  

We are currently paying Home Health Aides an hourly rate of $22 an hour

  

\\*Wages Reflected are a range based on multiple factors. Inquire within about our Competitive Wage Matching Programs and Wages based on experience\\*

  

Not Certified? Inquire Within about our Certification Program!

  

Can't wait to talk to someone? Call 800-681-0900 and ask to speak to someone in our Recruiting Department.  



  

  

Right at Home is an e/o/e

title: Live In HHA Position
description:
Right at Home is seeking Live-In Certified Home Health Aides (HHA) to work in Ocean County and the Southern Part of Monmouth County. We are currently offering $190 a day.  



  

About Us: Right at Home is an at-home care service provider for residents of Monmouth and Ocean Counties. We provide services for seniors and disabled adults who need some assistance with daily living. By doing so, we allow our clients to enjoy the ability to stay home longer and have a better overall quality of life. We have been taking care of our neighbors since 2004 and have been growing ever since.

  

What is a Live In Home Health Aide/HHA?

  

A Live-In HHA lives with their client 24 hours a day, 7 days a week. As a Live In, you will work for 10 hours a day, sleep for 8 hours, have 3 hours a day of rest breaks and 3 hours a day of meal breaks. Please Note: If you are not interested in Live In Cases and would prefer HOURLY WORK, please be available in South Monmouth and Ocean Counties.

  

Right at Home can provide amazing opportunities that include work/life balance and consistent work. In addition, taking time off at Right at Home is as easy as a phone call. Give us 2 weeks notice and we will have coverage for you.  



  

Are you a NON-CERTIFIED LIVE-IN CAREGIVER? Complete the application process and accept work-We will give you access to the certification course governed by the New Jersey Board of Nursing FOR FREE!

  

Here's Why Our Live-In Caregivers Like Working for Us:

  

* Free Career Consultation from our Professional Recruiting Staff
* Transportation from nearest Bus or Train station to and from your case once a month
* Same Day Pay Available!
* 401K
* Health Insurance for as little as $15 a pay check
* Competitive Wage Matching
* Attractive Sign-on and Referral Bonus
* Paid Vacation and Holidays
* Paid Sick Time
* Free Tele-Medicine for all Full-Time employees
* Quick Turnaround in between cases (Our Live-Ins NEVER wait for work) and so much more!!
* Named Employer of Choice by Home Care Pulse
* Free PPE to keep you safe!

  

Responsibilities and Duties:

  

* Performs personal care activities that assist the patient with activities of daily living which include (but are not limited to):
* Personal hygiene (assisting to bathroom or in using a bedpan, bathing, care of mouth, shaving, skin, and hair)
* Ambulation/Transfers
* Eating
* Dressing/Shaving
* Prepares meals and snacks according to instructions
* Accompany patient on errands or medical appointments.
* Performs housekeeping activities which include (but are not limited to): vacuuming, dusting, sweeping or mopping floors, doing dishes, changing bed linens, doing laundry and cleaning bathroom
* Performs patient-specific activities that are taught by a Right at Home nurse. These could include (but are not limited to):

  

* Medication reminders
* Assisting with the prescribed range of motion exercises
* Measuring and preparing special diets
* Understanding dementia care
* Incontinence care

  

Qualifications and Skills:

  

* High school graduate or G.E.D. certificate preferred.
* Must be eligible to work in the U.S.
* Must be able to provide proper work authorization documentation
* HHAs Must be able to obtain proper medical clearance
* A Valid Driver’s License/Auto Insurance/Vehicle (Preferred but not required)
* Ability to read, write, speak and understand English as needed for the job.
* A 1-Step PPD OR QuantiFERON with Negative results dated no older than one year. Positive results require a chest x-ray dated no older than 5 years.

  

If you consider yourself a hard-working Live-in Companion or CHHA that is looking to make a difference with a company that values you, we would love to hear from you. Apply today for immediate consideration! For Immediate consideration, call 800-681-0900. Ask for a member of our Recruiting Team.

title: Certification and Caregiver Companion Opportunity
description:
Come join the #1 Fastest Growing Industry in The United States!

  

What is better than joining a team that was just nominated as Employer of Choice and Provider of Choice 2024 by Caring.com and Great Place to Work Certified 2024? The answer is nothing! However, we couldn't get these distinguished awards without the most important thing.....YOU!

 **About Us**: Right at Home is an in-home care service provider for residents of Monmouth and Ocean Counties. We provide services for seniors and disabled adults who need some assistance with daily living. By doing so, we allow our clients to enjoy the ability to stay home longer and have a better overall quality of life. We have been taking care of our neighbors since 2004 and have been growing ever since.

  

Due to an increase in demand for our services, we have brought our CHHA training program in house to better meet the needs of those interested. Our class is online so you can work while you are training! Where most companies charge $500-$1000+ for the SAME training, ours is **ONLY $299!** Also, we offer the opportunity for **FULL REIMBURSEMENT!**

  

Become a CHHA from the comfort of your own home in 76 hours! Guaranteed Work while you are taking the course and Full Time after completion!

  

Participants can work either before or after training is completed. Employees will receive a pay increase immediately upon completing the class to match your new skillset. If you decide to work during the training, it is limited to part time, so you can focus on completing the course.

  

What YOU Would Do: As a dedicated member of our team, you will be the eyes and ears for Right at Home. It is expected that you are always in communication with our office team to ensure that the client is receiving the appropriate level of care.

  

Daily tasks can include, but are not limited to: light housekeeping, meal preparation, laundry and other household chores, running errands with or for our clients, accompanying clients to appointments, etc... .

  

Job Requirements:

  

Must be at least 18 years of age


Must be eligible to work in the U.S. and able to provide proper work authorization documentation


High School Diploma or GED Preferred


Must have a 1-Step PPD OR QuantiFERON with Negative results dated no older than one year. Positive results require a chest x-ray dated no older than 5 years.


***Valid Driver’s License/Auto Insurance/Vehicle to work as a companion is required***

  

What We Offer:

  

Non-Certified Companions are currently earning $16 an hour with an increase once the certification is earned.




Our Caregivers and CHHAs are the lifeblood of our business, and we do everything in our ability to reward our hard working staff. Some of our perks include but are not limited to:

* Free Career Consultation From our Professional Recruiting Staff
* Same Day Pay
* 401K
* Competitive Wage Matching
* $1000 Sign-on and Referral Bonus
* Paid Sick Time
* Case to Case Travel Pay
* Paid Errand Mileage and so much more!!

  

Ask us about our Earn and Learn Program where we offer you the **CHHA Course for Free...…..AND WE PAY YOU TO TAKE THE COURSE!**

  

For more information regarding the CHHA Course, please visit https://njchhaclass.com/ or call us directly at **800-681-0900**

title: OR Circulating Nurse
description:
Position Title: Registered Nurse - Circulator/Scrub  
**Supervisor: Director of Nursing**

**Supervises: None**

***Mission and Values:***

*In the performance of one’s job, the employee reflects the Company Mission by participating in the provision of convenient cost-effective, quality surgical care.*

*Values: Confidentiality*

*Quality*

*Teamwork*

*Trust*

*Respect*

***Job Summary:***

*Utilizes the nursing process to provide comprehensive nursing care during the peri-operative phase. Coordinates total patient care in coordination with other health team members particularly the Center’s team. Functions as a patient advocate utilizing the Patient’s Bill of Rights. Demonstrates professional growth and development by accepting responsibility and accountability for one’s nursing practice.*

***Key Areas of Responsibility:***

*A. Assessment*

* *Competency to assess the physiological health status of the patient.*
* *Verifies the operative procedure using the consent form, the patient’s statement and if needed the surgeon’s verification prior to procedure.*
* *Notes the condition of the skin for rashes, bruises, lesions, and previous incisions.*
* *Determines mobility of the body using the patient’s statement, range of motion, and the history and physical.*
* *Reports deviation of diagnostic studies such as lab or radiology reports.*
* *Checks pre-operative vital signs upon admission to surgery: blood pressure, pulse, respirations, and temperature.*
* *Notes nutritional status such as patient has been NPO.*
* *Verifies allergies to medication, food, or chemicals.*
* *Communicates and documents physiological data to other members of the surgical and health care team in verbal or written report, including data which might be relevant to discharge planning.*
* *Competency to assess the psychological health status of the patient/family.*
* *Elicits patient expectations of care and outcome of surgery.*
* *Determines level of knowledge and ability to understand, such as language barrier and seeks assistance as necessary.*
* *Identifies philosophical, religious, and cultural beliefs concerning the intraoperative phase, such as blood transfusions, disposition of limbs, and sacraments.*
* *Communicates and documents psychological data to other members of the surgical and health care team in verbal and written report, including data which might be relevant to discharge planning.*

*3. Formulates nursing diagnosis based on health status data.*

*B. Planning*

* *Competency to establish realistic and attainable goals based on nursing diagnosis and to develop a plan of care based on nursing actions to achieve patient goals.*
* *Provides positioning aids during the intraoperative phase to prevent skin breakdown or impairment of the nervous or vascular system.*
* *Provides equipment to insure patient safety in regard to electrosurgery and laser.*
* *Coordinates use of supplies and equipment for intraoperative care.*
* *Organizes nursing activities in logical sequence, prioritizing nursing actions.*
* *Coordinates patient care needs with other members of the surgical and health care team.*
* *Assigns activities to appropriate personnel based on their qualifications and patient needs.*
* *Maintains required certifications (CPR) and performs effectively in an emergency situation.*
* *Communicates and documents patient’s plan of care to other members of the surgical and health care team in verbal and written report, including that which might be relevant to discharge planning.*

*C. Implementation*

* *Competency to implement nursing actions in transferring the patient according to the plan of care.*
* *Confirms the patient identity using bracelet and patient’s statement.*
* *Selects appropriate personnel for transport as determined by patient acuity and number of staff needed.*
* *Determines appropriate and safe method of transport.*
* *Provides for emotional needs during transport.*
* *Communicates and documents method of transport.*
* *Competency to participate in patient/family teaching.*
* *Participates in pre-operative teaching as needed, such as explanation of surgical routine and environment.*
* *Communicates and documents patient/family teaching.*
* *Competency to create and maintain a sterile field.*
* *Uses principles of aseptic technique in varying situations, such as infection control practices, skin preps, demonstrated knowledge of clean vs. sterile.*
* *Initiates corrective action when breaks in technique occur.*
* *Maintains sterility while opening sterile items for procedure, including pouring solutions.*
* *Inspects sterile items for integrity of package, sterile indicator and/or outdate prior to delivery to the field.*
* *Adheres to dress code policy for peri-operative area(s).*
* *Monitors suite to ensure that movement around the sterile field is appropriate at all times.*
* *The R.N. circulator duties include being in the OR suite during the intra-operative phase.*
* *Communicates and documents maintenance of / compromise of sterile field.*
* *Competency to provide equipment and supplies based on patient needs.*
* *Anticipates needed equipment and supplies, utilizing the surgeon preference card.*
* *Selects equipment and supplies in an organized, timely and cost-effective manner throughout the peri-operative phase.*
* *Assures all equipment is functioning before use.*
* *Operates mechanical, electrical, and powered equipment according to manufacturer’s instructions and the Center policy.*
* *Removes malfunctioning equipment from service, tags it appropriately and initiates repair.*
* *Uses supplies judiciously and in a cost-effective manner.*
* *Communicates and documents provision of equipment and supplies including charges.*
* *Competency to perform sponge, sharps and instrument counts.*
* *Follows policies for sponge, sharps, and instrument counts.*
* *Initiates corrective action when a count is incorrect.*
* *Communicates and documents results of counts according to policy.*
* *Competency to administer drugs and solutions as prescribed.*
* *Administers medications according to policy.*
* *Communicates and documents administration of medications and solutions according to policy, including medication errors.*
* *Competency to physiologically monitor the patient during the peri-operative phase,*
* *Assists/monitors physical symptoms, behavioral changes, intake and output, and vital signs.*
* *Initiates nursing actions or obtains physician order as appropriate, based on interpretation of physiological data/changes.*
* *Communicates and documents patient’s physiological response to other members of the surgical and health care team in verbal or written report, including that which might be relevant to discharge planning.*
* *Competency to monitor and control the environment.*
* *Controls the environment to provide ultimate patient care, such as temperature of room, sensory stimuli, and traffic and noise level.*
* *Adheres to all safety policies and procedures.*
* *Maintains appropriate traffic pattern in the peri-operative environment.*
* *Adheres to sanitation policies for infection control including confine and contain and waste disposal.*
* *Communicates and documents environmental controls or breaks in technique promptly and appropriately.*
* *Competency to respect patient’s rights.*
* *Demonstrates awareness and practices according to the Patient’s Bill of Rights and Center policy.*
* *Provides for patient safety and maintains patient confidentiality.*
* *Communicates and documents provision for patient’s rights as appropriate.*

*D. Evaluation*

* *Competency to perform nursing actions that demonstrate accountability.*
* *Exercises safe judgment in decision-making.*
* *Demonstrates flexibility and adaptability to changes in nursing practice.*
* *Responds in a positive manner to constructive criticism or recommendations for improvement.*
* *Demonstrates tact, understanding and good guest relations when dealing with patients, visitors, team members, and other units.*
* *Practices within ethical and legal guidelines.*
* *Seeks opportunities of continued learning.*
* *Communicates and documents nursing actions.*
* *Competency to evaluate patients.*
* *Develops outcome criteria and measures degree of achievement.*
* *Communicates and documents degree of goal achievement to other members of the surgical and health care team in verbal and written report, including that which might be relevant to discharge planning.*
* *Competency to evaluate effectiveness of nursing care.* ***Continuously evaluates the patient’s needs, plan of care, and nursing actions, adjusting the plan as required to provide optimum patient outcomes.***
* *Assesses the patient post-operatively and determines the effectiveness of care to desired patient goals.*
* *Communicates and documents effectiveness of care and results of nursing care to other members of the surgical and health care team in verbal or written report, including that which might be relevant to discharge planning.*
* *Participates in the Quality Improvement Program activities including identification of aspects of care, collection and analysis of data, formulation of recommendations, implementation of an improvement plan and evaluation of the process.*
* *In keeping with the teamwork philosophy, acts as a resource person to other staff.*
* *Adheres to OSHA guidelines for Universal Precautions for exposure to blood and body fluids, using appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE).*
* *Participates in the orientation of new employees, students and approved program participants.*
* *Attends Center staff and unit meetings, and educational opportunities.*
* *Demonstrates flexibility in meeting the needs of the Center.*
* *Follows AORN Recommended Practices and the Center’s policy at all times.*
* *Assists visitors, staff and physicians, utilizing good guest relations.*

*MINIMUM KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:*

* *Current State of New York nursing license.*
* *Current CPR licensure / ACLS.*
* *Required to successfully complete facility-wide competencies and medication administration exam provided.*
* *Demonstrated interpersonal communication skills.*
* *Prior knowledge of surgical instrumentation and peri-operative equipment or ability to learn same.*
* *Requires prolonged periods of standing and walking.*
* *Requires ability to perform lifting and transport of patients; and lifting of instrument trays and equipment weighing up to 40 pounds.*
* *Ability to work with a minimum of supervision and to organize work in order of importance.*
* *Ability to work effectively in stressful situations and in a variety of peri-operative environments.*
* *Requires manual dexterity to operate equipment and handle instrumentation, hearing to understand verbal instructions and near vision to distinguish supplies and instrumentation.*

*WORKING CONDITIONS:*

* *Accountability to OR Supervisor/Director of Nursing with indirect accountability to Management team.*
* *Normal peri-operative environment with exposure to chemical odors, cleaning solvents and other hazardous materials. Must follow established procedures to ensure safety.*
* *Exposure to possible injury when working with electrical equipment and lasers which require care and following proper safety procedures.*

*Based on the OSHA guidelines for protection against exposure to Hepatitis and HIV, this position is described as Category I. This means that this position has exposure to blood and body fluids. Policies are in place for Universal Precautions identifying exposure risks and appropriate barrier protection.*

*The above is intended to describe the general content and requirements for the performance for this position. It is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements.* 

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Per diem, PRN

Pay: $52.00 - $58.00 per hour

title: Wait Staff - Hiring Server
description:
We are looking for a competent **Restaurant Server/Waitstaff** to take and deliver orders. You’ll be the face of our restaurant and responsible for our customers’ experiences. Food server responsibilities include ensuring our tables are clean and tidy when guests arrive, presenting menus and serving food and beverages. You need to be quick on your feet (literally and metaphorically) and have a polite and friendly attitude. If you enjoy talking to people and thrive in a fast-paced workplace, we’d like to meet you. Your ultimate goal will be to provide high-quality service that will help us maintain and attract customers.

Responsibilities

* Prepare restaurant tables with special attention to sanitation and order
* Attend to and welcome customers upon entrance
* Present restaurant menus and help customers select food/beverages
* Take and serve orders
* Answer questions or make recommendations
* Collaborate with other restaurant servers and kitchen staff
* Deal with complaints or problems with a positive attitude
* Use a POS system to submit orders, issue bills and accept payment
* Clear and clean all dining and work areas (tables, chairs, counter, bathroom, floors, storefront)
* Enforce and abide by restaurant COVID policies

Skills

* Proven restaurant serving or waitering experience preferred
* Hands-on experience in cashier duties
* Attention to cleanliness and safety
* Patience and customer-oriented approach
* Excellent people skills with a friendly attitude
* Responsible and trustworthy
* Able to work under pressure and fast-paced environment

\\*\\* Need to be able to work nights

We are open from 12PM - 11PM everyday. Must be able to file taxes.

title: Tel Sell Representative
description:
**ABOUT US:**  
With a dedication to our people and our products, The Honickman Companies® are collectively one of the largest independent beverage employers in the country. Our Pepsi business includes distribution for brands like Pepsi-Cola, Starbucks, Lipton Teas, Gatorade, Evian and more, throughout the 5 Borough’s, Long Island, West Chester Co and Pennsauken NJ. If you are excited to work with some of the biggest brands in the world, in the biggest brand market in the world, come see what we have to offer. a passionate, self-motivated, and detail-oriented team player who is committed to the success of our customers. You will focus on growing and developing existing clients, as well as generating new business by identifying, implementing and executing new strategies.

**POSITION SUMMARY:** 

Call each assigned customer on their scheduled day for an order. Maintain a liaison between our customer base, Sales Reps, Route employees and all departments.

**REPRESENTATIVE RESPONSIBILITIES:** 

The following responsibilities are general duties that a particular employee in this position may or may not be required to perform. The actual duties required of this position will vary.

* Keep open communications with Sales reps, Route employees and all departments.
* Maintain good customer relations through daily sales calls and follow up.
* Control service frequency through proper balance of delivery schedule, and products to reduce call-ins.
* Keep track of customers with coolers and ensure they are buying the required number of cases (per the contract) in order to keep the cooler.
* Visits accounts as required.
* Keep route books up to date.
* Sell new products and current deals to customers.
* Communicate to customers any payment issues.
* Performs other job-related duties as assigned.

**EXPERIENCE, EDUCATION, CERTIFICATION:** 

* Equivalent of high school diploma or G.E.D certification and 2 years customer service experience or equivalent job duties.
* Associates degree or some college level coursework.
* Related training or certification.
* Experience with confidential files, documents and other information.
* Experience working in a team environment.
* Office equipment including, but not limited to, computer, phone, fax machine, copier and calculator.
* MS Office including Word and Excel.

*The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees and are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties, and skills required by personnel so classified. title: Executive Assistant
description:
**Position:** Executive Assistant

**Department:** Administration

**Reports To:** Director of Administration

**Annual Salary:** $85,000.00 - $95,000.00

**FLSA Status:** Non - Exempt

**Location:** 158-11 Harry Van Arsdale Jr. Avenue, Flushing NY, 11365

The Joint Industry Board of the Electrical Industry (JIB) was established in 1943 by the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers, Local Union No. 3 and employers affiliated with the National Electrical Contractors Association. Its mission is to promote harmony between employees and employers, administer benefits for members and their families and improve competitiveness through progressive management, education, training, and technology.

**JOB DESCRIPTION**

The Executive Assistant to the Director of Administration is responsible for providing comprehensive support to the Director. This dynamic position requires the ability to anticipate needs, think critically, and offer solutions to problems with a high level of professionalism and confidentiality.

* Communication - Drafting, reviewing, and sending communications on behalf of Director, answering, and responding to phone calls, and prioritizing emails.
* Maintain and update daily medical insurance invoices to ensure accurate records.
* Maintain the Director’s calendar, including scheduling meetings, appointments, speaking engagements, and travel arrangements. Exercise discretion in committing time and evaluating needs.
* Meetings - Organizing and preparing for meetings, including gathering documents and attending to logistics.
* Arrange and manage all logistics for Board meetings and events: schedule meetings; draft agendas; develop, compile, and distribute presentation materials; and record meeting minutes.
* Reviewing all contracts, agreements for all plans for director and legal counsel within the scanning system.
* Maintaining and updating 5500 and 990 forms within the scanning system.
* Responding promptly and efficiently to auditor’s requests.
* Other additional and/or alternative duties as assigned from time to time, including supporting other departments or Executives as needed.

**Work Environment**

We thrive to provide a supportive and collaborative environment. We are employee- focused emphasizing mutual respect a strong sense of community and a positive team culture. We offer a healthy work -life balances and a desirable work environment with a diverse workforce.

**Physical Demands**

Sedentary work environment with physical demands described are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the functions of this job. This would require the ability to lift files, pull files/forms/books, stand, bending, shred documents, open/close filing cabinets, as necessary.

**Position Type/Expected Hours of Work**

This is a full-time onsite 35 hours per week– Non-Exempt position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday, 8:30 AM to 4:30 PM.

**Flexibility:** Must be able to work overtime when necessary.

**Travel**: No travel is expected for this position.

**Required Experience, Skills, and Qualifications**.

* Bachelor’s degree preferred.
* Three to five years’ prior experience in supporting a senior executive or team.
* Expert proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, and Excel).
* Ability to design and edit graphic presentations and materials.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Excellent organization and time-management skills.
* Proficiency of the scanning system.

**Other Duties/Special Projects** 

A detail-oriented initiative-taker with prior experience working for a senior executive.

Someone who exhibits sound judgment with the ability to prioritize and make decisions.

Energetic and eager to tackle new projects and ideas.

Ability to react with appropriate levels of urgency to situations and events that require quick response or turnaround.

Comfortable interacting with high-level executives.

A team player capable of cultivating productive working relationships across the organization.

Resourceful, can-do attitude.

Exceptional organizational skills and impeccable attention to detail.

**Benefits**

This position is an outstanding opportunity for a highly motivated executive assistant to assume a pivotal role in a highly respected organization. As such, compensation for this role is competitive. The starting salary will be commensurate with candidate experience.

* Health, dental, vision, Rx after 26 weeks of employment.
* Paid disability, PFL and FMLA
* Life insurance.
* Paid vacation, PTO.
* 11 paid holidays.
* 401(k) – 10 percent of employer contribution.
* Retirement plan – Two Defined Pension Plan with vesting and age requirement, fully funded by employer.

**Reasonable Accommodations Statement** To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable Accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

description:
